intro: Navarretia capillaris, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. Navarretia capillaris is known for its delicate, grass-like leaves and its ability to thrive in coastal environments with mild, moist conditions. It is also a short-lived perennial, often completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
